project.teaser: The aim of the HAIKU Project is to deliver prototypes of AI Digital Assistants for different aviation segments and users: commercial aviation pilots, urban air mobility and sky taxis, remotely piloted drones, remote towers, and air traffic controllers. It is essential both for...
project.objective: The aim of the HAIKU Project is to deliver prototypes of AI Digital Assistants for different aviation segments and users: commercial aviation pilots, urban air mobility and sky taxis, remotely piloted drones, remote towers, and air traffic controllers. It is essential both for safe operations, and for society in general, that the people who currently keep aviation so safe can work with, train and supervise these AI systems, and that future autonomous AI systems make judgements and decisions that would be acceptable to humans. HAIKU will pave the way for human-centric-AI by developing guidance and assurance procedures, and by exploring Human-AI Teaming via several interactive prototypes. Three main research questions will be addressed: • What is the recommended human-AI relationship for each of the different AI applications in aviation? • What does it mean for AI to be explainable and hence trustworthy in each of these applications? • How do we best teach AIs, via human-in-the-loop AI learning for each of the potential aviation applications? The following main outputs are foreseen: 1. New Human Factors design guidance and methods (‘HF4AI’ Capabilities) on how to develop safe, effective and trustworthy Digital Assistants for Aviation 2. A set of aviation use cases – controlled experiments with high operational relevance – illustrating the tasks, roles, autonomy and team performance of the Digital Assistant in a range of normal and emergency scenarios 3. New safety and validation assurance methods for Digital Assistants, to facilitate early integration into aviation systems by aviation stakeholders and regulatory authorities 4. Continuous engagement with relevant stakeholders - e.g. policy makers, professional associations, passengers associations and general public – to deliver Guidance on socially acceptable AI in safety critical operations, and for maintaining aviation’s strong safety culture record.
project.title: Human AI teaming Knowledge and Understanding for aviation safety
project.keywords: Artificial Intelligence, Human-centric-AI, Human-AI interaction, AI assistants, Human Factors, Safety, Security, Liability, Learning, Societal impact

article.title: AI Digital Assistants for aviation safety

result.title: HAIKU project website
result.description: A project website including private and public areas will be opened

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - HAIKU (Human AI teaming Knowledge and Understanding for aviation safety)
result.teaser: HAIKU envisions developing Human-Centred AI-Based Intelligent Assistants for safe, secure, trustworthy, and effective Human-AI partnerships in aviation systems. Anchored in a truly human-centric approach, the HAIKU goal is to pave the way for AI integration in aviation...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Concepts of Intelligent Assistants
result.description: HAIKU concepts, describing the key elements both at the strategic level – i.e. AI purpose, expected benefits, values and design principles, (bidirectional) human-AI training,and workforce issues around implementation

result.title: Development of safety, HF and security approaches for HIAS
result.description: This report will present the Acceptable Means of Compliance to be applied and validated in Haiku Use Cases.

result.title: Validation of the SHS case-based approach in case studies
result.description: This report will present findings from the validation of the SHS case-based approach. To steer the design and development of Intelligent Assistants, interim reports on safety, security and Human Factors will be delivered to Use Case owners at M12 and M24

result.title: Analysis of Societal Impact
result.description: This document will present the results of Tasks 2.3 and 2.4 after the first half of the project.

result.title: Human-AI Teaming Validation Framework
result.description: Provisional framework for validating use case prototypes, including validation success criteria, constructs, metrics, measurement methods, instruments and protocols.

result.title: Project Management Plan
result.description: Project organisation in terms of team structure, roles, responsibilities and work plan. It describes the Quality Assurance procedure and the strategy to keep risks under control and mitigate them.

result.title: Social, Ethical, Legal, Privacy issues identification and monitoring (initial)
result.description: Identification of the guidelines for the project and the required documentations.

result.title: Interim report: Dissemination, Communication and Exploitantion
result.description: An interim report on all dissemination and communication activities performed

result.title: First validation strategy and plan
result.description: High level validation objectives, detailed objectives, corresponding indicators and metrics, and the workplan for the first validation

result.title: The Analysis and AI Simulation of Passenger Flows in an Airport Terminal: A Decision-Making Tool

details.authors: Afroditi Anagnostopoulou; Dimitrios Tolikas; Evangelos Spyrou; Attila Akac; Vassilios Kappatos
details.journalTitle: The Analysis and AI Simulation of Passen

result.title: Vision and scenarios
result.description: This document presents Haiku Vision, guiding principles, the description of reference scenarios for 2030 and 2050.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: Analysis of the main elements of the data management policy that will be used by the project partners.

result.title: Strategy for XAI in aviation
result.description: Interaction characteristics, sensors (visual, audio, etc.), datasets for training, information exchange between the human and AI, information presentation, adaptability and personalization will be included as proposed strategy.

category.title: drones
category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/electrical engineering, electronic engineering, information engineering/electronic engineering/robotics/autonomous robots/drones

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
